div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1227 Lesbos?, 1936 (614) Burial: 4th cent. B.C.? (M) Contents: 19 AR, 74 BIL, 10 AE Athens: 3 fr. (as BMC 112) Elaea: 1 AE Lesbos: 74 billon fr. Mytilene: 9 fr. 5 AE 1 dr. (as BMC 32 ff.) Eresus: 1 AE (as BMC 4-5) Nesos: 1 AE (as BMC 3-4) Phocaea: 1 fr. (as BMC 84) Cnidus: 2 AR Unc. mint: 3 fr. (as BMC, Samos 12-6) Unc. mints: 2 AE Disposition: London 5 Information from E. S. G. Robinson The combination of early AR (Phocaea and unc. mint) with late AE and AR from Lesbos is peculiar and throws some doubt on this hd.
